page.title: 15ST MARY'S CHURCH PRESTWICH
page.content:
In the graveyard there are people buried with very unusual names. These include River Jordan,Radcliffe Bridge and Alpha Omega. The oldest stone belongs to the ten children of Thomas Collier who all died,presumably in an epidemic,{"twixt the 1st and 12th of {December 1641" {} The arches along the central nave are all different heights and the pillars are not opposite each other.
The church possesses a peal of eight bells,four being mentioned in the time of Edward VI 1552. The bells are famous because at the end of the Second World War in 1945 the peal; was broadcast by the BBC to celebrate the occasion.
